articles.title: Portugal received support of 3,000 million euros from the European Investment Bank in 2025
articles.summary: Since 1976, the EIB has been providing financing and expertise for sound and sustainable investment in Portugal, totaling 61.07 billion euros.
articles.content:
Financing from the European Investment Bank (EIB) in Portugal increased to three billion euros in 2025, compared to 2.1 billion euros in 2024, the European Union (EU) financial institution announced today.

As part of the annual results released today in Brussels, the EIB group reports that, regarding financing by country, Portugal received three billion euros (1% of GDP) from the EU bank and 30 million euros through the Recovery and Resilience Facility (which funds the PRR) last year.

As for investment supported by the EIB in 2025, it reached 11.8 billion euros (3.9% of GDP).

In 2024, Portugal was one of the 10 main beneficiaries of EIB funds in terms of GDP, with financing totaling 2.1 billion euros, an amount equivalent to 1.7% of national Gross Domestic Product (GDP).

Since 1976, the EIB has been providing financing and expertise for sound and sustainable investment in Portugal, with a total of 525 projects already supported and 61.07 billion euros mobilized over this period, according to data available on the institution’s website.

The EIB group is composed of the European Investment Bank and the European Investment Fund.

The EU financial institution today announced that it made a record investment of 100 billion euros in 2025 to support European economic competitiveness and security.

The EIB is the EU’s financial institution, owned by the Member States, providing funds (loans on favorable terms) to respond to Europe’s economic, social and geopolitical challenges.

In recent years, the EIB has strengthened its involvement in the field of security and defense, reflecting the changing European and global geopolitical context.

The story focuses on a clear, meaningful financial support milestone with tangible benefits for national development.
articles.personality_title: Portugal receives record 3 billion euros from European Investment Bank in 2025
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – The European Investment Bank (EIB) is a financial institution owned by European Union countries. Since 1976, it has helped Portugal by providing loans and support for projects that promote sustainable growth and development.

**What happened** – In 2025, the EIB increased its financing to Portugal to 3 billion euros, up from 2.1 billion euros in 2024. This funding represents about 1% of Portugal’s total economic output, or GDP. The EIB also supported investments worth nearly 11.8 billion euros in Portugal last year. Over the decades, the bank has helped with 525 projects and invested more than 61 billion euros in the country.

**Impact** – This boost in funding is important because it helps Portugal improve its economy in a way that can last a long time. The money supports projects that create jobs, improve infrastructure, and promote clean energy. Being one of the top countries to receive EIB funds shows Portugal’s growing role in Europe’s economic plans.

**What's next step** – The EIB plans to keep supporting Portugal with favorable loans, especially in areas like security, defense, and sustainable development. This ongoing support can help Portugal face future challenges and continue building a stronger economy.

**One-sentence takeaway** – In 2025, Portugal received its highest-ever support from the European Investment Bank, boosting sustainable projects and economic growth across the country.
articles.personality_title_fr: Le Portugal reçoit un soutien record de 3 milliards d'euros de la Banque européenne d'investissement en 2025
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – La Banque européenne d'investissement (BEI) est une institution financière appartenant aux pays de l'Union européenne. Depuis 1976, elle aide le Portugal en accordant des prêts et un soutien pour des projets favorisant une croissance durable.

**Ce qui s'est passé** – En 2025, la BEI a augmenté son financement au Portugal à 3 milliards d'euros, contre 2,1 milliards en 2024. Ce financement représente environ 1 % du produit intérieur brut (PIB) du Portugal. La BEI a aussi soutenu des investissements d'une valeur de près de 11,8 milliards d'euros l'année dernière. Depuis plusieurs décennies, la banque a aidé à réaliser 525 projets et investi plus de 61 milliards d'euros dans le pays.

**Impact** – Cette augmentation des fonds est importante car elle aide le Portugal à améliorer son économie de manière durable. L'argent soutient des projets qui créent des emplois, améliorent les infrastructures et favorisent les énergies propres. Être l'un des principaux bénéficiaires des fonds de la BEI montre le rôle croissant du Portugal dans les plans économiques européens.

**Prochaine étape** – La BEI prévoit de continuer à soutenir le Portugal avec des prêts avantageux, notamment dans les domaines de la sécurité, de la défense et du développement durable. Ce soutien permanent peut aider le Portugal à relever les défis futurs et à renforcer son économie.

**Résumé en une phrase** – En 2025, le Portugal a reçu son soutien le plus important jamais accordé par la Banque européenne d'investissement, stimulant des projets durables et la croissance économique dans tout le pays.
articles.personality_title_es: Portugal recibe un récord de 3.000 millones de euros del Banco Europeo de Inversiones en 2025
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – El Banco Europeo de Inversiones (BEI) es una institución financiera propiedad de los países de la Unión Europea. Desde 1976, ha ayudado a Portugal proporcionando préstamos y apoyo para proyectos que promueven un crecimiento sostenible.

**Qué pasó** – En 2025, el BEI aumentó su financiación a Portugal a 3.000 millones de euros, frente a los 2.100 millones de euros de 2024. Este financiamiento representa cerca del 1 % del Producto Interno Bruto (PIB) de Portugal. Además, el BEI apoyó inversiones por un valor de casi 11.800 millones de euros en Portugal el año pasado. A lo largo de las décadas, el banco ha apoyado 525 proyectos e invertido más de 61.000 millones de euros en el país.

**Impacto** – Este aumento en los fondos es importante porque ayuda a Portugal a mejorar su economía de forma duradera. El dinero apoya proyectos que crean empleos, mejoran infraestructuras y fomentan la energía limpia. Ser uno de los principales países beneficiarios de los fondos del BEI muestra el papel creciente de Portugal en los planes económicos europeos.

**Próximo paso** – El BEI planea seguir apoyando a Portugal con préstamos favorables, especialmente en áreas como seguridad, defensa y desarrollo sostenible. Este apoyo continuo puede ayudar a Portugal a enfrentar futuros desafíos y a fortalecer su economía.

**Conclusión en una frase** – En 2025, Portugal recibió su mayor apoyo hasta ahora del Banco Europeo de Inversiones, impulsando proyectos sostenibles y el crecimiento económico en todo el país.
